title: Can't play games, can't re-install client
body:
I'm getting a RADS error every time I try to start the client after re-installing it that says 

"Could not connect to the HTTP server. Please check that your internet connection is enabled and that your firewall is not blocking access."

1. My internet is clearly working, otherwise I wouldn't be writing this post
2. My firewall is disabled simply because its a nuisance to me

I tried the hextech repair kit, but to no avail, and my logs can be found [here](https://www.mediafire.com/?84q5wwgbl20i957).

This only started happening after the flex queue patch to fix the placements people were having.

An interesting note is that I was still able to receive messages on the new client even though I was "not connected."

replies.body:
Since patches only change local files inside of your League directory, it's **extremely unlikely** they've affected your connection. This issue is most often caused by local network configurations that conflict with League, so I'd recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to get everything compatible.

Let me know if you continue to experience this issue after taking those steps.

After disabling windows defender, the client started, once. It downloaded 5 megabytes then gave me an error which in a haste, didn't read thoroughly, but I know it said something about my connection, then stopped downloading anything. Now we're back to square one, as the client won't open again. Same error, same steps.

Ok, here's another update, after letting my computer sit for a while and just browsing reddit, et cetera. The client started, and it's downloading the game. I honestly did nothing between the time of it not working and now. So my only thought is that my ISP is doing something wonky. At this time I'm downloading the game and will provide an update once it's finished.
